page.title: 13LAND USE AND FARMS-WENTHILLS
page.content: By far the greater part of the land within the area surveyed belongs to the Stapleton Park estate. Two other farms are given as examples. Castle Farm was built in Regency Gothic style. It was the shooting estate for Stapleton Hall. The stone used came from Brockadale,and is the same stone as that used for the Houses of Parliament.The top land is limestone and the lower land is clay and peat. It is very good arable land after drainage. Rectory Farm, Wentbridge has 178 acres and is worked by three members of the family. No livestock is kept. The crops grown are wheat, barley and sugarbeet. This emphasis on crops rather than livestock is typical of the area. Quite a large amount of land is given over to mixed plantations.
